subject: Cooking
title: Toasting Spices: The Dry Heat Trick
description: A short lesson to help you apply Toasting Spices: The Dry Heat Trick.

hook.text: Raw cumin smells dusty. Toast it for 60 seconds and it smells like a spice market. Same seed, new world.

buildup.text: Dry-toasting triggers the Maillard reaction in spice proteins, creating dozens of new flavor compounds.

discovery.text: Heat also cracks open essential oil cells, releasing volatile aromatics trapped inside the seed.

twist.text: But 10 seconds too long and those same compounds burn â€” bitterness replaces complexity instantly.

climax.text: Indian cooks toast whole spices first, then grind. This preserves freshness until the moment of use.

punchline.text: One minute of dry heat unlocks flavors that raw spices hide.
